rating:
Retrying to Viki after a long time. I stopped because they moved a lot of theirs shows to another tier that cost even more money. At time the translators were unpaid volunteers that received some membership benefits. The translators were/are the best part. . Sadly app doesn’t work for me. The ad will pop up but it will not start playing. The screen is then frozen so my only option is to close it and keep trying. Had no luck. I can’t watch anything. . Also I’m not sure why the viewers history was removed. It’s such a useful feature that helps us keep track of what we’ve watched.
***update***
Got it to work. I believe one particular Ad was the problem. I clicked on “learn more” and it opened we up the ads website, went back to Viki and video started playing. I skipped forward and got another set of ads. Those played without delay.

rating: I love that the developers are opening this app for free and joy of any charge to those wanting to watch K-dramas. I’m currently watching Mouse, and ads ruin the mood SO MUCH. I rarely ever complain but this is too much. there are 3 ads in one row and it really makes viewers like me annoyed because a few ads are fine, yet not when it’s often every 10 minutes. I understand it covers the costs for us being able to watch movies and shows freely. however, I wish it were better. For us to enjoy actually watching, there should be a limit on ads :/… one second im watching something incredibly sad and next I have to go past an ad that’s 30 seconds long (each 3 of the ads) Creators, please understand and do something about controlling the length and occurrence of the ads. Thank you.

rating: It’s really good for being free, but there are lots of things that you do need to buy in it if you want to watch certain things but that’s ok, BUT the main thing that’s bothering me and the reason I am writing this review otherwise I would have kept my mouth shut is that within 20 minutes I had 6.5 minutes of ads so I only had 13.5 minutes of watching the actual show and you typically get 3 ads IN A ROW, and that just seems a bit excessive to me and you get them four times for a 30-40 minute long episode and it’s quite ridiculous, but overall it has a lot of great qualitys as far as subtitles and free aspect so I would definitely recommend it if you have any patience for ads at all it will be great. I do think the app is great  as a whole tho

rating: So…I’m gonna change my review. This time it’s just about the ads, it’s always been a problem I guess. The ads…there are just so many ad brakes in one episode alone. If I’m being honest, I don’t think ANY app should have to have THAT MANY ADS! And sometimes, the ads can be quite long. So, don’t take this the wrong way, the app is great! In fact, I watch most of my k-dramas and other stuff here! But..sometimes it would just be great to have less and brakes and maybe 1-2 ads in each….thank you for taking the time to read this and understand (if you did) and I hope that you continue to have the wonderful app!

rating:
I used to love Viki. Enough to be a VIP subscriber for the past few years. I loved the great collection of dramas and reality/variety shows (which included all of the primary episodes)! However, in the past year, Viki managed to remove all of the earlier episodes from reality shows like " 나 혼자 산다" which was one of the reasons I got the VIP pass~ to be able to rewatch those old but gold episodes! 
As subscribers, we did not received any notification regarding these major changes and whether they would be temporary or permanent! I see the comments from the other subscribers being genuinely upset about this lack of courtesy from Viki, but my comments keep getting deleted on the app! 
None of the contents we originally loved and subscribed to Viki for are available. What's the point of paying for the VIP subscription/ month if there is no quality content available anymore?!!!
title: False

rating: Excellent app with outstanding content! For those complaining about adds, spend the $6 per month to get rid of them. Geez! Vast amount of high quality content for basically two cups of coffee. We are fortunate to have Viki and the dedicated teams translating, bringing so much great Asian content to other parts of the world. So much less expensive than tracking down and purchasing expensive DVD/Blu Ray’s that go out of print quickly! And the app works great on my Apple and Roku devices. My only recommendation is for Viki to add additional older historical K-dramas. I would really love to be able to stream “Six Flying Dragons”, “Jumong”, “Emperor of the Sea” and others.
title: False

rating: I have had this app for a month now, and it is one of the best apps I’ve ever had! My dad got me a subscription because the only thing that annoyed me was the same ads replaying back to back, plus there was something I really wanted to watch that was only on Standard. The no ads have been great! When I did have them it didn’t annoy me too much, only when I had the same long ad playing four times back to back. I hope to see new dramas added this year! A drama I would love to see added is called Be With You starring Ji Xiao Bing and Zhang Ya Qin from 2020! Overall, this app is absolutely perfect and has so many different shows!

rating: While I can see that this app is great for those who subscribe to it, it’s really craptastic for those who are not subscribe. I understand that the ads are there for non-paying customers but, holy crap on crack, those ads are so annoying. Not only does it play literally almost every 4 minutes, it also crashes the app and then when you try again it makes you watch the same commercials that crashed the app in the first place. I wanted to give this app a chance but this crappy experience just makes me not want to. I get that I can remove the ads by paying but I assess apps based on their offerings for non-paying customers. If non-paying customers are happy with an app then guaranteed the paid version is even better. I can’t say the same for this app. Greedy.

rating: I have recently got into BL dramas and stories, and for awhile I was just fine with books. But then, I was doing research online and found I could watch the shows that (some) of these books are based on. And that’s when I found this wonderful app, it has been such a joy to watch these stories come to life with amazing actors, and to aid in my understanding of the different cultures and countries these stories are from. I love everything about this app, and I appreciate everyone who does the translations. (I’m in the process of learning Thai so hopefully I won’t need them for long)!

rating: No better content out there if you wish to watch Asian dramas. However, the apps are full of bugs. For example, it doesn’t sync across or even withIN devices. So if you’re watching on an iPad, don’t count on the app tracking which episodes you’ve watched when you’re using your iPhone. What’s worse is the app “forgets” which episodes you’ve watched ON THE SAME DEVICE. There’s also an annoying bug that keeps asking you to leave real-time comments while watching the show, even if you’ve turned this stupid feature off. Rakuten can do much better here - please improve the app to match the quality of your content.

rating: I’ve had Viki in the past and we decided to revisit and subscribe. I downloaded the app and subscribed for the year and used my Apple ID to login. This caused issues because not all of our TVs or tablets use Apple. My wife also purchased a monthly subscription at the same time so I requested my subscription be canceled so that we can use her subscription with her email and password to login to all electronics. They refused to cancel and process a refund. So now, I paid $99 annual and wife paid $9.99 monthly. She has canceled her subscriptionSo that they don’t charge her in the upcoming months. This seems like an unfair practice which we will further explore.
title: False

rating: One of my 4 sources for Asian dramas, especially BLs.  I haven’t not been a subscriber since I first discovered the absolute, pure awesomeness and joy of Asian dramas. Then I discovered the existence of Boy’s Love dramas and that was it. My joyfully anti-social life is complete. I will never not have a subscription to Viki. This is a must for Asian dramas. It’s just to good and worth it to me.

review: {'id': 18973739, 'body': 'Hi Chubasco, we apologise for the error on the Apple TV device. It has now been fixed. We are also working to provide a unified experience across devices so you can enjoy watching on whichever platform you prefer. ', 'modified': '2020-11-09T03:14:43Z'}
rating: The app has the worst bugs in the 2nd most important function of a streaming service. It can’t properly keep track of your progress. Nearly 100% of the time it either starts me at the beginning of the last completed episode, or starts me nearly at the end of the next episode, or both. And with no “restart from beginning” option I’m forced to rewind through the entire episode that I want to watch…is this a 1986 VHS tape rental Easter egg? If so, then it might be funny if I weren’t paying for this service. This would be a 4 or 5 star service we’re it not for the worst bugs in the most basic of functionality.
title: True
column7: Unacceptable bugs in a paid service

But the problem is, is that there’s just too much ads some of the ads can be up to 3 and 30 seconds without a skip button it makes me annoyed but again this is the best app for watching shows and movies and it’s all free!!

rating: I wanted to download a specific drama to watch offline, the app prompted me to upgrade and purchase a more expensive pass to do so. After paying for it, it no longer allowed me to download the drama so I tried reaching out to customer service. They asked me a long list of questions trying to see if it was a technical issue on my end (which it wasn’t). They still haven’t resolved my issue nor given me a refund. It’s really frustrating to also speak with customer service or technical support all via email as it’s really slow, time consuming, and not accessible at all. It’s also annoying to get a ton of separate emails for just 1 issue.

rating: First of all, the video compression is sub par.  Streaming takes too much bandwidth adding to the cost of viewing on this platform.  Second, the functionality is kludgy to say the least.  Controls do not allow you to start over, skip intros or even resume where one left off.   Episodes don’t have descriptions.  The app interferes with the operation of other basic Apple apps.  I could go on…but being the only content provider for the shows we want, we have to deal with this ‘Beggar’s’ version of a streaming app.
title: False
column7: Functionality far inferior to Netflix, Prime Video and Other Platforms

rating:
I love the app and all but sometimes i cant watch what im trying too for one of 2 reasons, without having to pay for episodes or there’s too many adds. 

I would REALLY appreciate if the adds PER 2 MINUTES were lowered. Like have them at least spread out in the episode and not all together. That makes it really frustrating to watch. 

And for the “special episodes” i would REALLY like to be able to watch them more freely. For example, i was trying to figure out what app i could watch “Don’t say no” (a bl) on. I came across Viki and tried it out. I did end up watching it on here but i couldnt get the episode i was really hoping for.

Overall. Good app just would appreciate the thought of being able to watch without interruptions. Wouldnt rlly recommend. Unless you’re okay with LOTS of adds and not able to watch specific things.

rating:
I really enjoy watching  Viki TV.

However, all of my disappointments fall in line in recognizing that Viki doesn’t have or seem to want to have open and honest feedback on their programming. 
 1. There should be  built in to each show an opportunity to give it a thumbs up or thumbs down.
 2. Maybe a category to WATCH AGAIN.
3. Listen and respond to subscribers on anticipated shows not currently shown in region and make real attempts to release those programs.
4. STOP deleting huge blocks of episodes of variety shows.  You can always break them down by seasons or year (s).
5. Make attempt to bring to screen majority if not all works done by major artists.  From early works to present. (If possible)

These requests seem to be basic without passing costs to accommodate them on to subscribers by hiking membership costs.

Thank you.

rating:
Good variety of movies & tv. Streaming quality excellent.
Minor issue with ads. Rather than video ads, it sometimes just pauses the video and plays an audio ad. They repeat too often, sometimes the same ad in three successive breaks. 
Video ads can also be repetitive, sometimes back to back in the same break.
Can’t beat the price (free) though, so it’s all good.
I’d like to see a filter for free tv/movies, but I understand why not.

rating: Recommend using another service if possible. Subtitle translations range from awkward to flat-out wrong (eg 5 thousand vs 5 million).  But the Premium service in particular is a scam. The main benefit seems to be downloading episodes to watch later. However, the downloaded content feature is so buggy that I regret paying anything for it. One time on a plane the app logged me out of my account and I couldn’t log back in (that was a long 5 hours). Another time all the content I had downloaded inexplicably disappeared. (Tech support says they’re working on it, but I haven’t heard of any progress for a week now.) Sometimes trying to play downloaded content simply crashes the app. This all happened within a week of me signing up for the service, so I’m sure there are more bugs that I just haven’t experienced yet. In addition, learning mode simply does not work without an internet connection, even when viewing downloaded content. This does not appear to be a bug, but appears to be by design, and tech support told me that it is not a priority for them to fix right now. I thought learning mode was one of the selling points of this service, but since it requires an internet connection to use anyways, I recommend getting the language reactor extension to chrome and using any other streaming service if possible. If the content you are looking for can only be found on Viki, whatever you do, sign up for the cheapest monthly plan possible and cancel it once you’ve seen what you want. I made the mistake of purchasing a year membership in advance, thinking I would use this service enough for it to be worth it. Then when I foolishly attempted to upgrade to a premium membership in order to download content for some travel, I was forced to either purchase and annual premium membership or wait until my annual basic membership had expired. Now I’m short $125 with only buggy, poorly translated streaming service to pay for it. Of course, Viki says that none of this justifies a refund. Save yourself. Don’t do what I did. If you must use Viki to watch your favorite show, pay the minimum amount then cancel your subscription immediately.
title: False
column7: READ THIS before paying for PREMIUM MEMBERSHIP

rating:
Because although a lot of the movies are great they’re  trying to cheat me out of my money and they’ve done it before. This happened last January but I couldn’t prove it so I just let it go. This year it happened again and this time I had proof. So what did they do? They cancelled my subscription. How did they cheat me? Well on January 6th they charged my accounts its monthly fee, I had no problem with that because that’s what I signed up for after all. 
———————————————————————————————————Then on January 28th they charged me again. I thought they were doing the February bill early but I was still uneasy so I wrote apple to watch out and please make sure they don’t charge me again un February since I had paid already on January 28th. I made sure that I still had my receipts stating that the transactions had gone through. But lo and behold on February 5th I was charged again. I immediately found my receipts and sent everything to apple. They decided in my favor, (although the refund has yet to be sent back to my account). Next thing know my subscription was cancelled and when I say cancelled I mean immediately everything was shut down. You know how they usually give you the last month? Not so they didn’t even give me that.—————————————————————————————————————- So here I am with over $30 spent for a one month subscription period. I sent the evidence to Viki as well but still nothing. So like I said, although some their movies are great I can only give one star because they’re trying to cheat me. If you want to charge me twice in the first month of the year I MIGHT have agreed to it if you sent a notice or something stating that this would happen, but the fact that you trying to sneak and do it is what gets me. You didn’t tell me you just did it. —————————————————————————————————————-Last but not least, If this is a computer glitch then I most humbly apologize because obviously it wasn’t done on purpose, I truly do because my computer be acting whack sometimes too. But you need to get your IT department to fix it because I don’t like being cheated, no one does.

review: {'id': 37620119, 'body': "We're truly sorry to read that you had a negative experience with us! If there’s any way we can help you out further, please contact Viki Support here: https://watch.viki.com/help", 'modified': '2023-07-12T00:19:38Z'}
rating:
There is a support website where users post issues. The problem is that the “customer support” will acknowledge that the problem is being looked into and then, CLOSE the ticket!  

As if, they actually solved the problem!  By closing the ticket, they ignore you and dismiss the problem, sweep it under the rug and prevent other subscribers facing the same problem from voicing their similar concerns or opinions.  

I am a paid subscriber and have had the same issue for almost a year.  Once a month, I will open a case. Within a day, they will close the case but never resolve the issue.  They cut off all communication with me, the original poster.  They straight up GHOST you.

Once they forgot to close one of my cases immediately and several other users were able to comment on my issue and I could see that this was frustrating other subscribers worldwide.  They immediately “closed” the case with no resolution.  

If you go to their zendesk support page, you will see thousands of examples where subscribers open a case to point out a problem they are encountering only for the Viki “support” team to swiftly close the case, with no resolution, no conversation with the subscriber… just an automated response that essentially says, “We have received your message.  Your case is closed.  We are cutting off further communication.”

In short, if there’s any glitch or issue, please know that they will not even waste a single second to make anything right.  You will have to tolerate it until you reach a point, like I have, where you simply give up, wait for your subscription to run its course and eventually, unsubscribe.

rating:
I love the Korean Costume Period movies & tv series where romance & comedy is in them - also while as you get into the character’s history - you get their background history and a little of world history.    The Koreans have a delightful sense of humor.    The Viki Originals Iin this genre I enjoy very much.   I also liked Kocowa series and movies in this drama.   Not to crazy about the modern age ones.   Hope to see more rom.com in the costume period movies & series

Also make it where a member can go back and watch an episode or the series as often as they want - had a hard time doing it - 

My respect to the developers and staff - thank you

rating: I had signed up for a regular subscription then decided to upgrade to the premium subscription 2 months later.  I agreed to pay the difference of the 2 subscription plans for the remainder of the subscription (I opted to pay for the year), about $50. There was a pop box that asked if you agree to this amount.  Instead they charged for another full subscription, $99.99.  I reached out to them and they told me there would be no refund because I “agreed” to the amount.  They offered to give me a “complimentary” 6 months after the subscription period ends - which is about what they overcharged me.  I will also have to email them for the code 1 month prior to the end of my subscription, instead of it just being applied to my account.   VERY DISAPPOINTED.

title: False

rating: I love this app and it allows me to be able to watch all the dramas I want. I love K-Dramas and listening to the show, while reading the subtitles. I am rather new to K-Dramas but in the past year I have watched more than 30 plus shows. I love them. I started on Netflix but moved over to this app. It is totally worth the subscription. Sometimes they have the same shows here but in a different name. I was going to break up it’s K-Dramas after the ending of two shows since they sucked but I am glad that I have stuck with it. At 50 I find myself dreaming of going to Korea to find my “”chairman or Director” LOL. I am an autism teacher and have a savant in my class who is obsessed with languages and is teaching me how to read and speak Korean. As a middle school teacher we watch one video on YouTube a day to learn some new words and practice them throughout the day.  I love the sound of the Korean language . I listen to the Korean OTS station on pandora all day and even though I can’t understand it YET, I love it.  This app lets you search by region, genre and more. There are so many shows to watch and from what I can tell new ones come often. The only drawback is when you really like a new one you have to wait weeks sometimes for a new episode. I do find myself needing to step away at times due to not being able to stop until I finish just “one more episode” LOL then realizing only 2 hours of sleep before it is time to wake up. That is my drive to learn Korean so I can listen to the shows as well and not need to focus and read. This way I may get my house cleaned and laundry done. LOL
title: False
column7: Best App I have ever had

rating:
Viki is good.  Viki is cheaper.  I enjoy the content on  both.  But the picture quality, sound and the format on Netflix is superior. 
I love the in-depth reviews on Viki.  It is so much better than Netflix.  I feel as Viki’s audience grow, they will demand more and Viki will do the right thing and get with the “program “.  

I didn’t even include Amazon Prime Video because so many of the Amazon selections “now” have ads.  Amazon has become a loose loose situation for most of their users.
title: False

rating: Love this app. I  have used this app for about 4 years now. My daughter got it also,  it has such a great variety of dramas, learning the different cultures. It is my favorite of all apps. I must have watched about 200 or more dramas, some of them over and over. If you don’t mind reading the subtitles , you also will love the.variety.
title: False

rating:
I recently began using the Vikki app after being introduced to them via “Alchemy of Souls” and “Love Between a Fairy and Devil”Netflix and Amazon Prime. I searched YouTube for top recommendations and discovered that many classics such as “My Lovely Sasoon” (Awesome) were on Vikki. 

The app itself is pretty stable and I love their detailed descriptions and biographical information on the performers which include their filmographies and other films that I would like if I liked the show I was watching and is pretty spot on. I probably do not fit the typical demographic for this genre (a 68 year old first generation Irish American woman) or maybe I do because I love good drama especially when the subtitles are well done. I still hate dubbed films because it takes away from the authenticity and emotional content of the actors voices.

Thank you Vikki and other streaming apps for the joy of exploring Asian culture through films.
title: False
column7: This is a wonderful app for fans of Asian Dramas

rating:
I recently started using this app because I was looking for a very specific drama and it was on here. I used to only watch the extremely limited selections on Netflix, Hulu, Prime, or even the random niche ones in the animé streaming apps. They all have quite a few but rarely could I find two with the same actor, or they would all be very old ones, or all would be completely different genres. Some of the ones I loved even disappeared like Strong Woman Do Bong-Soon for example. But since using this app and browsing it, I’ve found all sorts of familiar faces, series I had heard of but never found, or series I missed.
I find it very easy to navigate, especially the buttons for the different region dramas. 
The descriptions are good and I love how it lists the actors and then gives you information about them.
I especially love, and this is what actually made me write this review, the subtitle teams. They all have names specific to their dramas and they’re so fun and they do a good job. I love how they will explain in the subtitles what cultural significance and definitions of things are.
Im glad I finally was able to take some time and start using this one.
title: False

review: {'id': 34919855, 'body': 'Thanks for reaching out! For any questions or concerns, contact our Help Center: bit.ly/VikiHelp', 'modified': '2023-02-17T05:45:53Z'}
rating: I love this app so much! Has such a great collection of dramas, I’ve watched 90% of my personal list on this app. I do want to say that there could definitely be improvements made to the app! Having the timed comments button hidden in the menu options on mobile devices really hinders the experience for me since I like to toggle it on/off at various times. I’d like to see it have it’s own spot on the main screen. Maybe this is just me being picky, but I also notice a slight lag when pressing on the screen to pause or do whatever else on the screen. It’s not as fluid as other apps like YouTube in my opinion, not the end of the world, though. I hope this app can continue to grow more in the future!!
title: False
column7: Would love some improvements to the UI

rating:
I don’t normally write reviews for apps but I felt like one was needed for this. First is I LOVE this app. It’s free to sign up and even if you don’t have viki pass (standard or premium) you still have access to a lot of shows and movies. You can also watch shows while they’re on air as well. The English subtitles are great, nicely translated and not to fast. Btw the subtitle teams work really fast so you don’t have to wait too long for an episode in %100 English to come out.
I also like how you can find collections and how there shows from all over Asia, Japan, Thailand, Korea, China. However lately l have been getting issues with the ads. Whenever an ad comes up or will freeze and the only way to get out of it is to click learn more and go back into the app. Even then it only plays for like 2 seconds or none at all. It’s just really annoying and slows down the experience. I also don’t like how you can’t change your username or profile in general. This is just a preference bc I like to customize things. Overall it’s a great app to watch lots of free shows and movies. Thank, have fun binging <3
title: False
column7: Good but a few minor problems

rating: This is such a great service! It has so many Asian dramas!! I was watching a few of the dramas on YouTube but this is a lot better! It felt like it took more time to find new or exciting dramas that I liked when I was searching for them on my own. Also, I enjoy having many options to choose from as far as C and K dramas. There are new (to me) dramas that are not even on Netflix. I would definitely recommend this service to friends.

review: {'id': 34761703, 'body': 'Thanks for reaching out! For any questions or concerns, contact our Help Center: bit.ly/VikiHelp', 'modified': '2023-02-09T01:32:58Z'}
rating:
Things I like about Vicki: Excellent subtitles. A good selection of new releases and classic movies and tv shows from several Asian countries.

Search feature works pretty well: you can filter by country as well as by genre. You can search by a show’s title, actor’s name or director’s name, but searching by a person’s name will only bring up their IMDB profile. Adding links to an actor or director’s available movies when you search their name would be a helpful addition.

Customer reviews are easy to write and edit. You have option of a numerical rating only (1 to 10 stars) or writing a full review. Reviews with spoiler alerts are marked with an asterisk. They also have a separate “conversation” section where customers can chat about shows they are watching online.

Unfortunately, reviews are not translated, and since I only speak English, I don’t have access to reviews written in other languages. It would be nice if they would add a translator app, as Amazon does for their customer reviews.

Other things I would change or add: 1) add the name of the character under the actor’s picture in the “about” section, as the IMDB picture doesn’t always match their appearance in the movie or tv show; 2) make it possible to search the actors in a scene/cast while watching the movie or tv show (similar to the X-Ray feature on Amazon Prime); 3) move the trailers up to a more prominent place (you currently have to scroll all the way to the bottom of the page on the “about” section. I didn’t discover the trailers until months after I started using the Vicki app); 4) add a customer feedback link to allow customers to make suggestions on improving the app or requesting to add specific shows/movies.

I got a response from the developer of this app to do all those things but those doesn’t work. It’s not a video issue either.
